## PathUtils.relative() method

Computes a relative path from one path to another.

Behavior: - Both `from` and `to` are normalized first. - The returned path does not start with "/" (relative form). - If both resolve to the same path, returns ".".

Examples: - relative('/a/b/c', '/a/d/e') -<!-- -->&gt; '../../d/e' - relative('/a/b', '/a/b/c') -<!-- -->&gt; 'c' - relative('/a/b', '/a/b') -<!-- -->&gt; '.'

**Signature:**

```typescript
static relative(from: string, to: string): string;
```

<tr><td>

string


</td><td>

Target path to reach.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

string

Relative path from `from` to `to`<!-- -->.
